stories.fact: Bangladesh's BNP political party won a majority of parliamentary seats in national elections.
White House Homeland Security Advisor discussed Minnesota immigration policy following two fatal shootings
Police report previous interactions with a suspect in a mass shooting in Canada.
Two individuals accused of using military secrets for financial trading
The U.S. Senate blocked Homeland Security funding legislation.
Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents were arrested in recent months.
Police identified 8 people killed in a shooting in Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia.
General Counsel Karen Ruemmler resigned from Goldman Sachs.
Japan reported seizing a Chinese vessel.
Environmental Protection Agency revokes scientific finding related to climate change policy
France's Laurane Miradoli won silver medal in Women's Super-G at Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics
President Trump eliminated legal foundation for climate regulations
Indian unions and farmers conducted a nationwide strike in response to an interim trade deal with the United States
President Cyril Ramaphosa announced military deployment to address criminal activity in South Africa
The U.S. government stated that European nations should take the lead on defense in NATO.
Ukrainian athlete Vladyslav Heraskevych will not compete in the Winter Olympics
NATO leaders will gather for the Munich Security Conference.
Ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine continues into its 1,450th day.
A shooting in Canada resulted in 9 deaths and 25 injuries at a school and home.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy stated that Ukraine has backed US peace proposals.
Portugal approved restrictions on social media access for children.
A shooting at South Carolina State University resulted in two deaths and one injury.
Turkey detained 16 individuals in connection with OnlyFans activity and seized $6.9 million in assets.
One person died and hundreds of thousands lost power in France during Storm Nils.
The FBI released a description of a suspect in the Nancy Guthrie kidnapping.
French astronaut Sophie Adenot and crew launched to the International Space Station.
Ukraine expects final International Monetary Fund deal approval in coming weeks.
A court ruled the UK's decision to ban Palestine Action as a terrorist group was unlawful.
More than 5,000 ISIL detainees were transferred from Syria according to the Iraqi ministry.
stories.source: Al Jazeera English - 9.2* (5/5) | The Straits Times - 9.0* (6/6)

stories.fact: A second U.S. aircraft carrier is heading to the Middle East, according to U.S. media reports.
Police identified 8 people killed in a shooting in Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia.
One person was killed and six were injured in a Russian air attack on a port in Ukraine's Odesa region, according to a deputy prime minister.
President Emmanuel Macron called for stronger measures against antisemitism in France.
German Chancellor called on the US and Europe to repair and revive trans-Atlantic trust.
stories.source: The Globe and Mail - 8.7* (2/2) | Associated Press - 9.9* (8/8)

stories.fact: Three skiers died in an avalanche at Val d'Isère resort in France.
The Trump administration filed a lawsuit against Harvard University regarding an admissions probe.
The United Nations reports 6,000 deaths in a Sudanese city over three days.
Russia and Ukraine are scheduled to hold talks in Geneva next week.
stories.source: Al Jazeera English - 9.6* (7/7) | The Globe and Mail - 9.0* (4/4)

stories.fact: President Trump pardoned 5 former NFL players convicted of offenses ranging from perjury to drug trafficking.
Paris police fired on a knife attacker at the Arc de Triomphe.
Trump stated he will visit Venezuela.
stories.source: The Straits Times - 10.0 (10/10) | EFE News Agency - 8.8*

stories.fact: Senators urged President Trump to eliminate social media vetting for foreign tourists.
